text: Bruce Burgess (1925-2000) was an Australian rugby league footballer who played in the 1950s. Former N.S.W. Country Seconds winger, Burgess joined St. George from the Waratah Mayfield rugby league club, Newcastle, New South Wales in 1950. Burgess was frequently the Reserve Grade replacement for Ron Roberts and Noel Pidding. Burgess left the Saints at the end of the 1952 season. Alan Whiticker/Glen Hudson: Encyclopedia of Rugby League Players, 1995. SYDNEY MORNING HERALD (Bruce Burgess) 21/3/1951 https://trove.nla.gov.au/newspaper/article/18205022?searchTerm=%22BURGESS%22%20%22st.george%22&searchLimits;=l-state=New+South+Wales|||l-decade=195 Burgess died on 24 October 2000 at Peakhurst, New South Wales.Sydney Morning Herald (Death Notice) 26/10/2000 ==References== Category:Australian rugby league players Category:St. George Dragons players Category:Rugby league wingers Category:1925 births Category:2000 deaths
